info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg County through 215 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Uptown Charlotte, or near Southpark Mall. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Pineville and Freedom Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
